pullRequest.body:
I've prove that tensor product of Azumaya algebra is still Azumaya, this PR is a prerequisite.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [09fa8aa786](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21446/commits/09fa8aa786ca36d4bb8b77be034865e69d7c01aa)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Azumaya.Basic` (new file)|1085|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Azumaya.Matrix` (new file)|1102|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix.comp_inv:`
`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix.inv_comp:`
`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix_inv`
`+ AlgHom.mulLeftRight_bij`
`+ _root_.FaithfulSMul.ofInjective`
`+ coe_tensorEquivEnd:`
`+ id`
`+ instance (M : Type*) [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [Module.Free R M] [Nontrivial M] :`
`+ instance (ι : Type*) [Nonempty ι] [DecidableEq ι] [Nontrivial R]: FaithfulSMul R (ι →₀ R)`
`+ matrix`
`+ mulLeftRight_comp_congr`
`+ of_AlgEquiv`
`+ tensorEquivEnd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1384|1|erw|

Current commit [09fa8aa786](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/09fa8aa786ca36d4bb8b77be034865e69d7c01aa)
Reference commit [de715a348f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/de715a348f421a70c608a4cfa6a5c107944c914a)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
untested but I think should work:

```suggestion
noncomputable abbrev tensorEquivEnd : R ⊗[R] Rᵐᵒᵖ ≃ₐ[R] Module.End R R :=
```
Similar below.

```suggestion
instance self : IsAzumaya R R where
```

```suggestion
theorem of_commRing : IsAzumaya R R where
```
or perhaps
```suggestion
theorem _root_.CommRing.toIsAzumaya : IsAzumaya R R where
```

This name seems to suggest that either any commutative algebra is Azumaya, or that `R` is an Azumaya over `R` only when `R` is commutative. The former is false, and the latter seems off because I don't think there is a good notion of Azumaya algebra over a non-commutative base.
I'll just leave it for now

> I'll just leave it for now

What does this mean?

> > I'll just leave it for now
> 
> What does this mean?

I mean I'll hold off the change till we finish the discussion on the name :-(
Maybe `IsAzumaya.id` in analogy to [Algebra.id](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Defs.html#Algebra.id).
Sounds good I'll change
changed!

```suggestion
  bij := by rw [← tensorEquivEnd_eq_mulLeftRight]; exact tensorEquivEnd R |>.bijective
```
Probably should be called `mulLeftRight_comp_congr` or something similar.
changed!
This should be moved elsewhere, and I think `LinearEquiv` is enough?
where do you think I shold move it to?
Also it seems AlgEquiv is necessary I need both map_smul and map_one

The result is true for linear equivs. An injection might even be enough. You need a different proof though. 
Where does `#min_imports` suggest you put it?
`#min_imports` says `Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupAction.Hom`?
Yeah seems to make sense.

```suggestion
theorem of_AlgEquiv (e : A ≃ₐ[R] B) [IsAzumaya R A] : IsAzumaya R B :=
```
And you probably shouldn't mention `hA` in the proof.
You should add a lemma `AlgHom.mulLeftRight_bijective` that has `[IsAzumaya R A]` as an assumption.
added
I think this holds for any nontrivial free module?
generalised!

```suggestion
lemma coe_tensorEquivEnd : tensorEquivEnd R = AlgHom.mulLeftRight R R := by
```
since there is a coercion on (at least) the LHS.
done!

```suggestion
abbrev AlgHom.mulLeftRightMatrix_inv :
    Module.End R (Matrix n n R) →ₗ[R] Matrix n n R ⊗[R] (Matrix n n R)ᵐᵒᵖ where
```

```suggestion
variable (R A B : Type*) [CommSemiring R] [Ring A] [Ring B] [Algebra R A] [Algebra R B]
```
changed!

```suggestion
variable (R n : Type*) [CommSemiring R] [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]
```
changed!

```suggestion
theorem Matrix [Nonempty n]: IsAzumaya R (Matrix n n R) where
```
changed, turns out I need `[Nonempty n]` and `[Nontrivial R]`

Does this generalize to 
```suggestion
abbrev AlgHom.mulLeftRightInv (b : Basis n R A) :
    Module.End R A →ₗ[R] A ⊗[R] Aᵐᵒᵖ where
```
It's not true that every finite-dimensional nontrivial algebra over a field is Azumaya (equivalently, central simple) ...
This belongs in another file. Does it generalize to broader classes of `Module`?

Here [DecidableEq ι] and [Nontrivial R] should definitely be removed. When [Subsingleton R] is assumed you don't even need to assume [Nonempty ι] (make sure to mark it @[nontriviality]). You can make a version assuming `Basis ι R M` too. Another direction of generalization is to assume [FaithfulSMul R M] and conclude `FaithfulSMul R (ι →₀ M)`.
As for "classes of `Module`" I don't think there's much beyond nontrivial free modules. For example, the action of `R × S` on the projective `R × S`-module `R × 0` is not faithful if S is nontrivial.

```suggestion
instance (M : Type*) [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [Module.Free R M] [Nontrivial M] :
```

```suggestion
- `IsAzumaya.id`: `R` is an Azumaya algebra over itself.
```

Why not
```suggestion

lemma AlgHom.mulLeftRight_bij [h : IsAzumaya R A] :
    Function.Bijective (AlgHom.mulLeftRight R A) := h.bij
```
?

```suggestion
    (hf : Function.Injective f) :
```

Probably you should use MulActionHomClass so it applies to LinearMap and AlgHom too?
For MulActionHom there's this [notation](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3eb0ff709449ce0401b0032e17d61dd0f5d51b46/Mathlib/GroupTheory/GroupAction/Hom.lean#L101-L105).

```suggestion
  by sending `f` to `∑ᵢⱼₖₗ f(Eⱼₖ)ᵢₗ • Eᵢⱼ⊗Eₖₗ`. -/
```
or maybe clearer as
```suggestion
  by sending `f` to `∑ᵢₗₛₜ f(Eₛₜ)ᵢₗ • Eᵢₛ⊗Eₜₗ`. -/
```
Better to use LaTeX for code that isn't valid lean syntax I think
how do I type latex code in docstring, is it just by adding `$$`?

```suggestion
/-- A nontrivial matrix ring over `R` is an Azumaya algebra over `R`. -/
theorem matrix [Nonempty n] [Nontrivial R] : IsAzumaya R (Matrix n n R) where
```
`Nontrivial R` is also not necessary here. Probably easiest to use the `Basis` version of the FaithfulSMul instance.

pullRequest.title: feat(Mathlib/Algebra/Azumaya/Basic): More on azumaya
